item.title: [Global][Containers & Orchestration] - Managed Kubernetes Service update
item.description:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Apr 16, 08:00 - 16:00 UTC

Apr 10, 06:05 UTC
Scheduled - As part of our continuous improvement plan, maintenance is scheduled on our Managed Kubernetes Service offer.

Start time : 16/04/2024 08:00 UTC
End time : 16/04/2024 16:00 UTC
Service impact : Some connections will be reset or may be refused, from K8S nodes or kubectl CLI, for few seconds.
Service improvement : : Following our continuous improvement policy, we are deploying a new configuration of our ingress gateway for MKS ControlPlane to get a better resilient following recent outages on GRA7 and GRA9.

Thank you for your understanding.

item.title: [GRA5/GRA7/GRA9/GRA11][Public Cloud] - Managed Kubernetes Service - Managed Private Registry
item.description:
Apr 9, 08:18 UTC
Resolved - Start time : 09/04/2024 06:46 UTC
End time : 09/04/2024 07:18 UTC
Service Impact : A part of Control planes Nodes were not responding and some registries were not accessible during the outage due to a disjunction on a rack.
Root cause : https://bare-metal-servers.status-ovhcloud.com/incidents/xb76vqn9h8s5
PCI tenants impacted are listed here: https://public-cloud.status-ovhcloud.com/incidents/zb1s08rfstpn
Our technical teams resolved the issue. All impacted services are now operational.

item.title: PCI - GRA5 GRA7 GRA9 GRA11 - rack G265A05
[GRA11][Public Cloud] - API Unstable
item.description:
Apr 4, 07:33 UTC
Resolved - Start time : 03/04/2024 00:06 UTC
End time : 03/04/2024 16:04 UTC
Service impact : The network API is currently unstable causing future network configuration changes to not be applying correctly. No impact on connectivity of the service.
Root cause : https://public-cloud.status-ovhcloud.com/incidents/897ngd9y00sq
Our technical teams resolved the issue. All impacted services are now operational.

Apr 3, 16:04 UTC
Update - All fixes been applied.
The incident is now resolved.
Our teams will keep monitoring closely the situation.

Apr 3, 15:31 UTC
Update - A fix is currently being deployed on our infrastructure to mitigate all the issues.
Managed Kubernetes Services may still be experiencing minor impacts like attaching and detaching volumes.

Apr 3, 04:34 UTC
Monitoring - A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

Apr 3, 03:18 UTC
Identified - Start time : 03/04/2024 00:06 UTC
Service impact : The network API is currently unstable causing future network configuration changes to not be applying correctly. No impact on connectivity of the service.
Root cause : https://public-cloud.status-ovhcloud.com/incidents/897ngd9y00sq
Ongoing actions : our technical teams are working on a fix.

item.title: [EU][Public Cloud] - Management incident notification
item.description:
Apr 9, 13:54 UTC
Update - Our teams are preparing a patch to mitigate this issue.
Maintenance notifications will be sent.
We apologize for any inconvenience caused.

Mar 21, 14:26 UTC
Update - We are continuing to work on a fix for this issue.

Mar 20, 19:23 UTC
Update - After a deep investigation by our technical teams, they found that local zones can be added by submitting a request from the manager, but will take more time than expected.
Our technical teams are currently preparing a fix to resolve the latency problem and the error message displayed on the manager which does not represent the actual status of the request.

Mar 20, 17:46 UTC
Identified - Start time : 20/03/2024 16:18 UTC
Service impact : Adding a new region or local zone through the manager for the Public Cloud offer may fail
Related incident : Incident link
Ongoing actions : Our technical teams are working on the issue. Update will be posted as significant progress is made.

item.title: [Global][Database] - Cloud Databases services MongoDB
item.description:
Mar 14, 17:34 UTC
Resolved - Start time : 14/03/2024 10:00 UTC
End time : 14/03/2024 17:25 UTC
Root cause :
If you experience difficulties to connect to your service following the creation or deletion of a password during the incident please reset user password.
The issue was in the automation that was not applying correctly the password. The password were not leaked nor compromised.

Mar 14, 16:43 UTC
Identified - Start time : 14/03/2024 10:00 UTC
Service impact :New user and user which the password have been reseted since beginning of the incident can't connect to the MongoDB service.
Root cause : Due to a bug introduced in user automation, password are not applied properly. Preventing customer from connecting to their Mongodb service.
Ongoing actions : Our technical teams are working on the issue. Update will be posted as significant progress is made.

item.title: [GRA5|GRA7|GRA9|GRA11|SBG5|WAW1|DE1|UK1][Public Cloud][Managed Kubernetes Service] - Maintenance on all nodes running in managed Kubernetes clusters
item.description:
Mar 14, 13:58 UTC
Completed - The scheduled maintenance has been completed.

Mar 12, 18:24 UTC
Scheduled - Start time : 14/03/2024 17:00 UTC
End time : 14/03/2024 23:00 UTC
Service impact : Interrupted connection up to 30 seconds between cluster controle plane and managed nodes workload when component names "ovhcloud-apiserver-proxy" restart (nodes processed sequentially).
Root cause : Update of "ovhcloud-apiserver-proxy" managed pods running in customers' Public Cloud instances to improve network connection between nodes and control planes. This patch is already delivered since one week ago, this maintenance only target existing managed clusters. Intervention will be done during non-working office hours.
